title: Gift for a Traveller
headline: The gift that fixes the worst part of every trip: the coffee.
editorial_intro: Anyone who travels regularly knows the quiet disappointment of hotel coffee. Instant sachets, pod machines with mystery capsules, or a lobby carafe that has been sitting since dawn. This gift eliminates all of that, permanently.

products.description: The Viaggio weighs 340 grams, fits in a jacket pocket, and produces genuine 9-bar espresso using nothing but hot water and a lever press. It is the gift that gets packed on every single trip after the first use. Include a bag of whole beans and a handwritten note about the best way to grind them, and you have a present that shows genuine thought.
The espresso maker itself — portable, manual, and capable of producing shots that rival countertop machines at a fraction of the size and weight.
A compact grinder that lets them grind fresh anywhere. Hotel rooms, Airbnbs, campervans — wherever there is a flat surface and a bag of beans.
The padded hardshell case holds both the Viaggio and Macinino with room for a small bag of beans. It is the detail that elevates this from a collection of items to a considered gift.

hero_image_alt: An Arco Viaggio in desert sand finish placed on a weathered leather travel journal beside a boarding pass, the Macinino grinder and hardshell travel case nearby, a small espresso in a metal camping cup, warm golden light suggesting a late afternoon somewhere far from home
